2022-2023 Games.name: Super Palette Swapper
2022-2023 Games.description: A 2D platformer that follows the journey of two artists reclaiming their collection of prized magical paints. Each color of paint added to the player's palette grants the player a unique ability that they can use to further traverse the levels or find once inaccessible secrets.
roster: Programmers: Scott Serafin, Evan McRae, Isaiah Hull

2022-2023 Games.name: Fall's End
2022-2023 Games.description: Falls End is a semi-open world fantasy RPG. It's about a man named Elric who has a small case of amnesia. He remembers that he was ordered by the military to meet someone in the country of Aloria. The funny thing is he doesn't remember any details of his mission. You play as Elric as you discover what your mission is and what tragedy is happening to the country of Aloria.
roster: Programmers: Ben Bolster, Aidan Brown, Jacob Pickholtz, Zach Nelson
Artists: Luke Schultz, Toni Olafunmiloye, Nektarios Tsoulfidis, TJ Colligan, Elizabeth Schaefer, Ryan Johnston

2022-2023 Games.name: Daylight
2022-2023 Games.description: You are a newly appointed warrior of a town of dogs to brave the dangerous, monster ridden outside world. In this 2D adventure, you collect survival resources and fight enemies to keep the town safe. But how much longer can the warriors hold the monsters back?
2022-2023 Games.tagline: 2D side scrolling story based adventure game
roster: Programmers: Evan McRae, Ryan Whitfield, Jeremy Niles, Shayan Khan

2022-2023 Games.name: Party Bullet Hell
2022-2023 Games.description: A party game where one player places down patterns of bullets while 1-3 other players try to dodge them.

2022-2023 Games.name: What Remains Unseen
2022-2023 Games.description: A psychological horror game where you play as a librarian working in your small town's grand library. Form bonds with other residents and learn more about this mysterious town during the day. Then, brave the night shift without letting your fear consume you. Complete your tasks and clock out before what lurks in the dark catches up to you... or is there something else that remains unseen?
roster: Writers: Billie Allen, Caleb Sparks, Eden Zhang

2023 Spring Semester Games.name: Boxmen
2023 Spring Semester Games.description: A Punch-Out!! inspired game where you box against a variety of fighters, all with different attacks and adaptations.

2023 Spring Semester Games.name: Untitled Zelda-like
roster: Programmers: Jacob Pickholtz, Brandon Griffin, Faezaan Ansari, Sean Henderson

2023 Spring Semester Games.name: Late Night Cooking
2023 Spring Semester Games.description: Experience college living through the time-old tradition of making dinner at 3 in the morning! There are also demons, which is a slightly less common experience, but something you get the luck of dealing with. Make late night delicacies while fending off the underworld.

2023 Spring Semester Games.name: Undead Ambush
2023 Spring Semester Games.description: An top down arcade-style zombie shooter that features many different enemies, wave variations, and weapons. It is planned to have a endless mode, and a short story mode as well.

2023 Spring Semester Games.name: A Workplace Romance
2023 Spring Semester Games.description: A hospital drama dating sim where you have a the chance to romance your co-star.
roster: Project Leads: Ayo Akinyemi, Anjum Hajera
Artists: Anjum Hajera, Ky DeSilva, Olivia Brooks
Writers: Ayo Akinyemi, Anjum Hajera, Olivia Brooks

2023 Spring Semester Games.name: Talali and Sonure
2023 Spring Semester Games.description: This visual novel follows a normal day in your life as the main caretaker of two developing gods who have opposite sleep schedules: Talali, a sun god in training, and Sonore, a moon god in training. Come have a good time and meet some cute kids!

2023 Spring Semester Games.name: 2D Fighters
2023 Spring Semester Games.description: A 2D fighting game involving multiple characters with unique fighting styles and several stages to choose from.

2022 Fall Semester Games.name: A Grave Tale
2022 Fall Semester Games.description: An action rouge-lite with checkpoints, leveling and gem progression as well as quests from the various townspeople and NPCs. You are a Grave Digger that found a magic book while digging a new grave and it sucked you in to a fantasy world and you need to work your way through a dungeon to escape the book. Your weapon is the shovel that got sucked in with you, and you can socket it with gems, to give yourself new abilities and such as you explore the dungeon.
roster: Programmers: Allison Smith, Kyle Williford, Macaela Morrison, Jeremy Nilles, Kurt Drexel
Artists: Stephen "Shaido" Bollinger, Felicia Edet, Macaela Morrison

2022 Fall Semester Games.name: Lost & Found
2022 Fall Semester Games.description: A 2D side-scrolling RPG set in a private high school run by a mysterious club called the “Seekers”. A transfer student named Blair joins the club in hopes of improving her social status by completing quests for fellow students. The tasks grow increasingly morally questionable, and Blair must carefully consider how far she’s willing to go for the sake of popularity.

2022 Fall Semester Games.name: Tindalos
2022 Fall Semester Games.description: A 3D survival horror runtime roguelike about quantum mechanics and eldritch abominations.

2022 Fall Semester Games.name: Letter to Hell
2022 Fall Semester Games.description: A roguelike in which you play as an angel tasked with delivering a letter to Lucifer.
roster: Programmers: Jacob Bond, David Abili, Janine James

2022 Fall Semester Games.name: Se7en Paths
2022 Fall Semester Games.description: A 2.5d boss rush where each boss is based on one of the 7 deadly sins. Each boss is unique and will take on the attributes of the others after you beat one.

2021-2022 Year Games.name: Snowman
2021-2022 Year Games.description: Project Snowman is a game where the player takes the role of a snowman's head and rolls around various levels in search of the rest of its body. Like a rolling snowball, the snowman's head grows in size as it rolls on snowy ground and eventually can become big enough to destroy obstacles in the environment.
roster: Team: Evan McRae, Jacob Pickholtz, Shane Taylor

2021-2022 Year Games.name: Hunter
2021-2022 Year Games.tagline: A hack-and-slash platformer with emphasis on combining combat and traversal.
2021-2022 Year Games.description: In Hunter, play as an assassin who's simply trying to do what she's getting paid for: slaughtering monsters that may pose a danger to others. But as you and your dragon wyrmling pal Vel venture deeper into the caves, things begin to not appear as they seem...
roster: Team: Isaiah Hull, Scott Serafin, Joey Kihn, Sam Denoncourt, Harrang Khalsa

2021-2022 Year Games.name: Satyr
2021-2022 Year Games.description: Satyr is a two-dimensional Metroidvania-inspired game with an emphasis on storytelling and world-building. The playable character Pan, a young boy who is part deer and part human, becomes possessed by the goddess Reya and they must work together to take down an evil empire. The player can explore an open world, fight enemies, and unlock new powers as they learn more about the world and the mysterious beings that inhabit it.
roster: Team: Aidan Brown, Evan McRae, Jacob Pickholtz, Zachary Nelson, Alex Cragg

2021-2022 Year Games.name: Lost & Found
2021-2022 Year Games.description: A 2D side-scrolling RPG set in a private high school run by a mysterious club called the “Seekers”. A transfer student named Blair joins the club in hopes of improving her social status by completing quests for fellow students. The tasks grow increasingly morally questionable, and Blair must carefully consider how far she’s willing to go for the sake of popularity.
roster: Team: Maxfield L. Hartley, Jet E. Thompson, Matthew T. Hustead, Phoenix Lawrence, Madelyn Holbrook, Toni Olafunmiloye

2021-2022 Year Games.name: DCOM
2021-2022 Year Games.description: A sport like no other, DCOM is a MOBA in which 4 teams of animals claim territory and attempt to keep the most of it before time runs out.
roster: Team: TJ  Colligan, Salad Chen, Joey Kihn, Zavier Howard

2021 Fall Semester Games.name: Final Fantasy Knockoff
2021 Fall Semester Games.tagline: A 2D RPG in the style of early Final Fantasy games

2021 Fall Semester Games.name: VR-Sail
2021 Fall Semester Games.description: A VR game where you explore an ocean by controlling a sail boat with motion controls.

2021 Fall Semester Games.name: Punch
2021 Fall Semester Games.description: A multiplayer VR Day-Z-genre game. Survival aspects with the need to scavenge food, water, and medicine, focused heavily on melee combat, including punching and swords.

2021 Fall Semester Games.name: Parry Rush
2021 Fall Semester Games.description: A 2.5d boss rush game where you can only attack by reflecting projectiles.

2021 Fall Semester Games.name: Hrabowski Kart
2021 Fall Semester Games.tagline: A Mario Kart-like game in Unreal Engine.

2020-2021 Games.name: Planetary Devastation
2020-2021 Games.description: A first-person space survival game with the goal of reinvigorating your destroyed home planet.

2020-2021 Games.name: Ele-mental
2020-2021 Games.description: A 3D puzzle shooter where you harness the power of the elements through the nozzle of your gun!

2020-2021 Games.name: Spare Parts
roster: Mathias Drgon: Project Lead, Programmer, Artist
2020-2021 Games.description:: An Oregon-Trail style game where you play as a ghost who's lost its body in a wildfire, you need to overcome unique obstacles to escape the fires and collect enough limbs and organs to get your body back.

2020 Semester Games.name: "Monsters" of Ikuna
2020 Semester Games.tagline: 2D side scroller platformer beat-em-up in a sci-fi themed story-driven adventure...and cat girls

2020 Semester Games.name: Dusk Before Moonlight
roster: Margaret Lucas: Project Lead, Artist, Programmer
Ernan Ochoa: Project Lead, Writer, Artist
2020 Semester Games.description: A visual novel about a newly-turned werewolf-man trying to become human again.

2020 Semester Games.name: Elderville
2020 Semester Games.description: A 2D Dungeon Crawler where an eldritch horror protects a village from other horrors of the night.

2019-2020 Games.name: Binary Bubbles
2019-2020 Games.tagline: Move and distribute code bubbles between machines in order to solve puzzles!
2019-2020 Games.description: A puzzle platformer in which the player has the unique ability to manipulate the code in all objects in order to reach the goal of each level

2019-2020 Games.name: Bad Boy: Tournament Edition
2019-2020 Games.tagline: 2D fighter sort of in-between Smash and traditional fighting games

2019-2020 Games.name: Invisible Ink
2019-2020 Games.tagline: 2D Choose your own adventure sidescroller with a similar premise to The Giver (but not really)

2019-2020 Games.name: Sludger
2019-2020 Games.description: A 2.5D twin-stick bullet hell with quirky characters and a variety of abilities. Has the mechanic of scaling player size to health.

2019-2020 Games.name: Modeling Mayhem
2019-2020 Games.description: A former model, having recently escaped from Hell, must become beautiful again in time for One Last Photoshoot. Squeeze through the layers of psychogeometry that make up each person's psyche so that you might manipulate them into letting you use their shower.\n\nIn the process you might, for the first time in your entire life, make a friend. :)

2019-2020 Games.name: Bit Rush
2019-2020 Games.tagline: A Visual Novel + 8-bit Platformer crossover mobile game about a high school student who plans to stop an evil corporation by buying out 51% of it's stock.
2019-2020 Games.description: A mobile game where on the bottom half of the phone screen you are a miner mining crystals to receive bitcoin, and as you harvest more bitcoin you get more miners. On the top of the screen you are reading a visual novel about a high school boy

2019-2020 Games.name: Pop-Up
2019-2020 Games.description: Journey through stories of kings, pilots, and dictators in Pop-Up, an action adventure across many stories of fiction and myths! Experience events told through different perspectives and timelines in a variety of settings in a retro 2D style.
roster: Team Lead/Lead Programmer/General Marketer: Charlie Hunter

2019-2020 Games.name: Myztree
2019-2020 Games.tagline: A 2.5D procedurally generated dungeon-crawler in a plant-infested world. Race against the clock to make it to the top!
2019-2020 Games.description: A realtime top-down dungeon crawler with the fast-paced mechanics of Gauntlet and Pokemon Mystery Dungeon where you make your way through floors of a proceedurally generated dungeon.

2019-2020 Games.name: Candybaggers
2019-2020 Games.description: A top-down arcade game about trick-or-treating, pulling pranks, and stealing candy from your friends with cute pixel art.
roster: Project Lead, Art, Sound: Aaron Tolbert-Smith

2019-2020 Games.name: Shatter Ball
2019-2020 Games.tagline: Race your way to the finish by launching a ball at top speed and slowing down time to dodge obstacles.
2019-2020 Games.description: Game for mobile where you control a ball. You can shoot it at high speeds and slow down time, get to the end of the course as fast as you can.

2019-2020 Games.name: New America: Businessman
2019-2020 Games.tagline: Trade-based point and click game with choices and consequences

2019-2020 Games.name: Fred and Red
2019-2020 Games.tagline: Guide mellow circles into holes using their attracting forces.

2018-2019 Games.name: Yonko Battle
2018-2019 Games.description: A gatcha-style twist on the classic Four-in-a-row game--designed exclusively for Android through the Godot Game Engine.  Complete with player customizations, voice acting, and online multiplayer.  Find your own strategy to connect your way to victory!
roster: Programming & UI: Anthony Ellis, Brandon Ellis, Young Lee
Artists: Michael Igoe, Kaela Chen, Virgilio Tan
Voice Acting: Alex Holstein, Nithya Prakash, Natalia Mitiuriev, Young Lee

2018-2019 Games.name: Harrowing Flight
2018-2019 Games.description: The invasion has begun! Alien starships have descended upon the solar system and Earth's forces must take to the skies to defend their home. Shoot down enemy starfighters, defend yourself with your movable shield, and avoid the terrifying firepower of the alien capital ships in Harrowing Flight, a 3D spaceship dogfighting game.

2018-2019 Games.name: Skeletons in Hats
2018-2019 Games.description: Skeletons in Hats is a 2-4 player game where each player is spawned in a small open world and given 5 - 10 minutes to compete for stat increases and hats that grant them special powers. The goal is to become the strongest skeleton and defeat the other players.
roster: Zachariah Hale: Project Lead, Programming Lead, 3D Artist

2018-2019 Games.name: Edgerson
2018-2019 Games.description: A challenging minimalist platformer in which the player traverses obstacles using many abilities such as dash, dodge, cannon, bounce, etc.
roster: Shawn Oppermann: Project Lead, Programmer, Musician, Artist(?), Pretty much everything

2018-2019 Games.name: Bad Boy
2018-2019 Games.description: Bad Boy is a 3D action platformer focusing on tight boss battles.  It's about a chubby little man with a heart full of rage versus the world's finest bounty hunters, monsters and goons.

2018-2019 Games.name: Crash Site
2018-2019 Games.description: A platformer about an explorer stranded on an alien planet. Fight enemies and pick up upgrades as you discover more and hopefully find a way out.

2018-2019 Games.name: Adryft
2018-2019 Games.description: Adryft is an Atmospheric 2D action game where light is key. You fight against horrid creatures, created from the melding of flesh and metal, with the only goal of sending you to your untimely demise. Can you survive alone and adryft in space?

2018-2019 Games.name: Role-Playing Gamble
2018-2019 Games.description: In this Turn Based RPG, our band of heroes traverses a dangerous, monster-infested college campus…to restore electricity for all students. Along the way, you’ll learn that luck is sometimes not on your side, with everything determined by a roll of the dice.
roster: Kristian Mischke: Lead Programmer, Network Programmer
Ryan Appleby: Assistant Programmer, Map Designer, Graphics
Craig Stone: Assistant Programmer, UI, Discord Implementation, MacOS Support

2018-2019 Games.name: Co-op Adventure
2018-2019 Games.description: Team up to rise up against the lizardmen! The little mage Emma and a mysterious ghost knight join forces to invade the home of the lizardmen and put an end to their tyranny.

2018-2019 Games.name: Arcade Hero
roster: Ben Przysucha: Project Lead, Lead Programmer
Paul Koh: Lead UI/UX Design, Lead Musician
2018-2019 Games.description: Arcade Hero is an isometric twin-stick shooter where you must escape from your childhood arcade overrun with cabinets taken over by a mysterious virus.

2017-2018 Games.name: Star Marten
2017-2018 Games.tagline: A platformer with mini games to boost your abilities
2017-2018 Games.description: In this 2D platformer, you control a marten, weaving your way through the solar system to stop the space dragon invasion.  Defeat enemies, collect stars, and power up to Galaxian form to make it to the star gate in one piece!

2017-2018 Games.name: Marzipan
2017-2018 Games.description: Marzipan is a 2D platformer shooter where you play as a little astronaut fighting aliens to try to get back home. Utilize the floaty moon gravity to maneuver around enemies and reach far away platforms to get back to your ship.
roster: Project Lead, Programming Lead, & Art Lead: Khadijah Wali
Programmers: Yitzhak Oshry, Young Lee, Cameron Blomquist

2017-2018 Games.name: Little Golem
2017-2018 Games.description: Little Golem is a puzzle adventure game which revolves around the mechanics of shifting gravity and rolling to solve puzzles.
roster: Skyler O’Neill: Project Lead, Programmer, and Level Designer
Zachariah Hale: Programming Lead and 3D Artist
Josh Ludlow: Art Lead, Environment Modeller
Mario Moya: Music, Concept Artist, and 3D Artist
Miguel Fuentes: 3D Character Artist and Animator

2017-2018 Games.name: Fansail
2017-2018 Games.tagline: An arcade-style survival game as you pilot a parachute through dangerous terrain while protecting passengers
2017-2018 Games.description: Fansail is a game about piloting a wind propelled parachute through dangerous terrain without keeling over and dropping your passengers. Instead of having a health bar, your success is measured by how many points you can collect on the way, and your failure occurs if the obstacles along the way successfully stop you from proceeding in a timely manner, or if they knock all of your passengers out.

2017-2018 Games.name: Top Cop
2017-2018 Games.tagline: A beat 'em up game where you battle against gangsters in an old action movie
2017-2018 Games.description: Project Hong Kong Top Cop is a side scrolling beat 'em up game where the player plays as a man in Hong Kong, attempting to survive in the streets against local thugs and gangsters. The game features melee combat, a blocking system, and (soon to be) combos that allow the player flexibility while playing; various enemies spawn to attempt to stop the player, and certain objectives related to the game, such as beating a certain number of enemies up or surviving for a certain amount of time, are the goals of the game.

2017-2018 Games.name: Phantom
2017-2018 Games.description: Project Phantom is a 2D point-and-click mystery game, in which the player solves murder mysteries and controls an investigative medium and the ghost of the murdered victim. The player can control Claire, a supernatural detective who can converse with ghosts, and the ghosts in order to collect evidence and convict the right suspect.

2017-2018 Games.name: Rock Dog
2017-2018 Games.description: A turn-based role-playing game where you control a rock-star as you play tunes across multiple venues

2017-2018 Games.name: Baby Dragon Assassin
2017-2018 Games.tagline: A stealth platformer game where you play as an imaginative child in daycare through their eyes and stealthily try to get your ball back from a bully
2017-2018 Games.description: Baby Dragon Assassin is a 2D platform game with stealth elements. The setting takes place in a daycare, consisting of two levels to start. The art aspect of the game is bright and child-like. The mechanics of the game with consists of 2D platforms, stealth secessions, hiding behind cloths and boxes, to avoid some enemies and an adult that will put you into time out. Two levels were created.

2017-2018 Games.name: Ultrariah
2017-2018 Games.description: A top-down shooter/stealth game with recruiting mechanics while you play as a cop hunting down criminals

2016-2017 Games.name: Umbra
2016-2017 Games.description: Umbra is an adventure-horror game with a twist. Friends and enemies alike have long since been turned to stone by an evil curse. They only move when the player closes their eyes. Hide and dash your way through an evil-infested castle as you dodge enemies and try to solve the curse to free your friends.

2016-2017 Games.name: Project Junker
2016-2017 Games.description: Designated for destruction and security closing in all sides, play an escaping robot armed with only ingenuity and its own body. Solve puzzles and elude enemies in a 3D world by deconstructing and reconstructing your body to navigate through obstacles.
roster: Creator, Project Lead & Art Lead: Ryley Mayer
Project Lead, Producer, & Programmer Lead: Shea Sandifer
Programmers: Young Lee, Toyosi Rayemo, Aaron Lewis

2016-2017 Games.name: Ricoshield
2016-2017 Games.description: Ricoshield is a half-semester project designed as a proof of concept for a potential future work. The player is equipped with a four directional shield, with which they can send both enemies and projectiles ricocheting across the area. With high-speed action and simple mechanics, Ricoshield aims to provide a viscerally pleasing experince to a wide variety of audiences.

2016-2017 Games.name: Catacombs
2016-2017 Games.description: Project Catacombs is a 2D sidescrolling platformer game. Explore treacherous caves and fight monsters. Pick up various weapons and switch characters to find your favorite fighting style.
roster: Team: Cameron Blomquist, Carolyn Wu, Courney Lovett, Dylan Haire, Emily Lambros, Igor Savchenko, Isiah Daniel, Nicholas Ho, Shelby Morales

2016-2017 Games.name: Put It Out
2016-2017 Games.description: Fulfill your duties as a fire extinguisher and put out the ever spreading fires threatening your surprisingly flammable room, but be careful not to run into the roaring flames as the force from your extinguisher pushes you around! This fast paced survival game was originally made in 48 hours for Ludum Dare 37 and can be played on PC and Android.

2016-2017 Games.name: Clogged
2016-2017 Games.description: Clogged is a shoot 'em up in which the player controls Tofu, firing projectiles at waves of enemies. Along the way, Tofu rescues various other characters that join her party and aid her in the form of projectile modifications.

2015-2016 Games.name: Legacy of the Shards
roster: Project and Art Lead: Andrea Wozniak
Artists: Jacqueline Wojcik, Erika Schumacher, Savanah May
2015-2016 Games.description: Set in a fantastical world filled with exploration, the player assumes the role of Aren, an adventurous youth seeking the means to travel beyond his home to find his long-lost parents. The game mechanics focus on classic platforming to explore and pursue nonlinear objectives. Players can approach quests and goals from several angles, building their own playstyle as they progress.
2015-2016 Games.customhtml:
Facebook

Twitter

2015-2016 Games.name: Dethroned
2015-2016 Games.description: A card game fusing Real-Time combat with the Hidden-Role genre. Simple enough for parties but deep enough for veteran gamers.
2015-2016 Games.customhtml: KiteLion Games, LLC on Facebook

2015-2016 Games.name: Sporbitals
roster: Project Lead and Programming Lead: Conrad Etherton

2014-2015 Games.name: Rolling Thunder
2014-2015 Games.description: Rolling Thunder is a tactical flight simulator, where big guns and reckless commands win the day.
roster: Artists: Dan Cassell, Katherine Dillon, Charles Douglas
Programmers: Bryan Jarrell, Joe O'Malley, Dakota Abernathy

2014-2015 Games.name: Secondhand
2014-2015 Games.description: A disease in unleashed upon a derelict cruise ship. When the vessel's mechanical servants begin a fatal quaratining, it's up to Henrietta, the ship's mechanic, to save whoever she can.

2014-2015 Games.name: Revolve Online
2014-2015 Games.description: Take control of the FPS genre by winning, gaining points, and spending them to make changes to ANY aspect of the game, permanently.
roster: Programming: Conrad Etherton, Roberto Melgar, Jed Song, Nathaniel J. Dorr

2014-2015 Games.name: Inheritance
2014-2015 Games.description: Inheritance is a 2D dungeon crawler where you can level up your parent characters to make a strong new class child how receive the inheritance of the past characters you controlled.
roster: Artists: Jacqueline Wojcik, Natalie Yoshioka, Vincent Lay

2014-2015 Games.name: HueBots
2014-2015 Games.description: HueBots is a top-down puzzle game where you can build and control little multicolored robots, which you must use to solve increasingly complicated puzzles. The goal of each level is to get your special white robot to the finish!

2013-2014 Projects.name: Project JACK
2013-2014 Projects.description: Multiplayer arena combat, with completely physics-simulated bodies. Lose a leg or break your spine, you can keep on fighting anyway! Changing gravity and a spread of weapons makes no two matches the same.

2013-2014 Projects.name: Insanitation Z
2013-2014 Projects.description: The zombie apocalypse has come and they aren't your average brain-dead zombies; they are hell spawns from a granite quarry explosion revelaing a dormant plantlike evil bent on consuming the entire world with its zombie spores.

2013-2014 Projects.name: EMT Merci
2013-2014 Projects.description: The battlefields of the far future are filled with casualties, and you're the only one who can save them. Play a combat medic equipped with the finest healing technology the future has to offer - a chainsaw lightsaber.
roster: Project, Design & Code Lead: Eliot Carney-Seim
Code: Alex Grube, James Millican, Roberto Melgar, Austin Chandler, Yu-Dean Wang, Kieth Chang
Art: Brianna Paige, Wilfred Brownell, Rachael Birky, Jake Duong

2013-2014 Projects.name: LeEK
2013-2014 Projects.description: After five years, a new generation of programmers are creating a new game engine from scratch. It's fast, versatile, and reliable - and after this year, this engine will be used to make new games with the latest technology.
roster: Code: Michael Leung, Jonathan Engbert, Chris Hamer

2011-2012 Games.name: Cosmoknights
2011-2012 Games.description: Cosmoknights is a 2D multiplayer action side-scroller in which astronauts from different countries crash their ships in the same asteroid field. Now they're in a race against each other to get ship pieces scattered in the asteroids to repair their ships and escape the field. Our goal for the project was to create a balanced multiplayer experience with a simple set of rules that players could pick up and understand easily.
2011-2012 Games.customhtml:
Development Challenges

The basic mechanics for the game did not take very long to implement, but balancing different factors like the speed of the player took a lot of play-testing. The biggest challenge was setting up the code to support different computers communicating fro multiplayer.

2011-2012 Games.name: Bounty Trial
2011-2012 Games.description: Starting form humble beginnings, an orphan leaves his hometown to discover his origins. Too poor to afford a steel helmet, he adorns himself with a wooden bucket instead. In this epic of the middle ages, Max must overcome sinister forces as well as his own insignificance. Set in the era of medieval castles and towns, this Hack and Slash 3rd person RPG adventure game includes interacting and adding characters to your group in order to win treasures from a variety of enemies in combat.
2011-2012 Games.customhtml:
Development Challenges

The most challenging aspect of the game was getting the characters to follow commands from the player seamlessly with smooth transitions from action to action as well as from moving in one direction to pulling out a sword and slashing in another direction. Some other difficulties we have experienced in using the Blender Game Engine was versioning as a team and using python scripts integrated into logic bricks.

2011-2012 Games.name: X-Zip-It!
2011-2012 Games.description: In a world where people can not unzip their own zippers, it is up to you and your magic unzipping powers to avert this catastrophe. You must unzip zippers on a variety of clothing types while dealing with various obstacles such as buttons, buckles and necklaces. Tap the buttons, pinch the buckles and avoid the deadly necklaces.
2011-2012 Games.customhtml:
Development Challenges

The most difficult aspect of this project was dealing with the platform that we chose, mobile devices.

We originally chose Android as our platform, and in doing so ran into a ton of issues as there are no solid game engines for Android devices. The best we could find were some libraries that made it marginally easier to make a game, but these libraries had annoying quirks that made programming a nightmare. In addition, the Android emulator was abysmal. It could not run our game at a consistent frame rate even in its most simple stages.

We ended up migrating everything to Windows Phone halfway through the year because the development environment was much more friendly.

The second biggest challenge has been trying to get the zipper behavior how we want it. It's been difficult to implement moving back and forth on the zipper track without running into game-breaking errors.

2010-2011 Games.name: Slug 3D
2010-2011 Games.description: Slug 3D is a platforming game encouraging evading obstacles, rather than trying to eliminate them as many platformers do currently. You play as the character Slug as you try to overcome different dangers solely through tactical retreat and makng use of her jumping and "slugtion" abilities. We still want to appeal to a more mature gaming crowd and are attempting to achieve this through increasing levels of difficulty.
2010-2011 Games.customhtml:
• The development started out with concepts and deciding on the genre of the game, as well as deciding which game mechanics we would like to feature.
  • From there we created a small prototype of the game, a single level which properly displayed everything we wanted the game to do, and then built on that prototype by adding enemies, obstacles, and more art assets.
  • Through this process we continued to make level after level until we had a complete game.

2010-2011 Games.name: Titan
2010-2011 Games.description: Titan is a multiplayer first person shooter game that takes place in the future on one of Saturn's moons: Titan. Titan uses realistic physics with future theoretical weapons.
2010-2011 Games.customhtml:
• The function of the "Dune Mover" is to pick up and push objects through space. Different objects have different mass and react differently under its force. This weapon can also pick up players and catch flying rockets.
  • The rocket launcher is a classic weapon which players will have to learn how to use strategically when fighting against opponents with more advanced technology.
  • The Gravity Gun's effect can be deadly if allowed to charge up to critical mass causing either a blackhole singularity or a downright outbursting explosion of force. If charged stablely the emitted gravity field effects can be used to curve projectiles, make force barriers, or even flush out opponents.
  • Graphics are rich and can be taxing for a computer. We set a small restriction which was rarely violated, to keep models under 10,000 polygons for a single model.
  • Level design mainly consists of futuristic developing colonies. Symmetrical design was used to allow nearly everything that's not bolted to the ground to be used in combat. The Unity 3D editor creates rich natural terrain and modeling programs such as 3Ds Max were used to make models and scenes.
  • Code is written in Javascript and C# using Unity's code system. The code is then attatched to objects in 3D space that objey the game's physics engine.

2010-2011 Games.name: Light
2010-2011 Games.description: Light is a puzzle-platformer set in a world that has been overcome by darkness. Making his way deep underground in search of the source of this darkness, the main character is aided by only trace amounts of light that remain. The player must take advantage of his prism-like body to split light into a variety of colors, each of which gives him a special ability. These abilities are useful in solving puzzles and defeating enemies, bringing him closer to reaching the source of darkness and restoring light to the world.
2010-2011 Games.customhtml:
Light was made in XNA with the FlatRedBall engine. This powerful engine has many tools available to assist in everything from editing animations to implementing AI. Many technical problems were avoided or easily worked around, allowing the team to focus on gameplay mechanics. Most of the time the player has very limited abilities, except when in the presence of light, which the player can use to harness special abilities - one for each color on the Xbox 360 controller. The main puzzle mechanic focuses on shooting light off a series of reflective surfaces, bouncing it at the correct angles so that the beam of light eventually hits a target that will change some part of the level and allow progression to the next room.

The team first worked on getting the mechanics working, and then shifted focus to building a world and puzzles. The goal was to have three levels, starting in a dark forest and progressing underground into a cave and finally to an underground temple where the story concludes.

2010-2011 Games.name: City of Gears
2010-2011 Games.description: City of Gears in a top-down role-playing game (RPG) set in a Victorian-esque "Steampunk" world. You play as the son of an airship captain after coming of age and the start of your adventures. Battle enemies, solve puzzles, and explore the world you live in. Each of the four starting classes; Warrior, Alchemist, Rogue and Ranger, have their own unique abilities and skills. Mechanics originate from Multi User Dungeons (MUDs), room-based combat, quests, and node-connected world maps. Mechanics are also drawn from modern RPGs and modernized graphics. Developement involved Flash and Actionscript 3, through the gaming library FlashPunk, developed by Chevy Ray Johnston (flashpunk.net).
2010-2011 Games.customhtml:
The development process provided many unique challenges. Due to the genre, we had high demand for art assets and a large quantity of in-game objects. This required efficient handling of object creation, level loading, and player state management. We developed several prototype engines and systems for handling these aspects of the code. Each implementation posed new concrete challenges with rendering, collision handling, media loading and management. We discovered FlashPunk as a sufficient code base that met our needs. Then, we ported our existing code into the current prototype. The prototype demonstrates an initial level and single player class in this environment. We also utilize an excellent 2D Map editor called OGMO, which simplifies the process of adding and customizing levels for the game. Utilizing xml projects and level files, OGMO produces levels that can be directly integrated into the game engine.

Future goals include more levels, character models and development of mechanics. We plan to incorporate a real-time turn-based combat system that will add more dynamic and strategic gameplay thus improving combat. Also, we will continue to develop simple conventions so that this code can be reused to produce other tileset/top-down games.

2008-2009 Games.name: Cryo and Pyro
2008-2009 Games.description: The primary goal is to create a fun and engaging game which works both on Microsoft Windows and Xbox 360 systems. The game will take the form of a side-scrolling 2D platformer with an emphasis on fast-based gameplay and combat. The game is designed to have two players cooperating in the same gameplay environment, each with different abilities. The players must use each of their respective abilities in tandem to traverse the level and reach the goal.
2008-2009 Games.customhtml:
In order to create the game we first had to create an engine, which is the framework on top of which the game is made. We decided to go with a pre-made engine in order to speed up development. The platform we chose is Microsoft XNA because it facilitates development on the Windows and Xbox platforms. Then programmers set to work fixing and modifying the engine to make it fit the game as envisioned. The artists began to work on concept artwork in order to set a visual style and decide how the game would look.

As the work progressed, the programmers then needed to start adding in more specific elements to the game. This includes menus, enemies, and other gameplay elements. The artists began to producwe sprites, which are the individual images which are being used by the game to create the image which is seen by the player. The programmers then began adding the sprites to the game. The final stage is balancing the enemies and creating levels for the players to play in.

2008-2009 Games.name: Gunther
2008-2009 Games.description: The goal of Gunther is to create a grimy fairy-tale world that revolved around the character Gunther, a mercenary looking to profit off a small town. The game is a 3rd person Hack and Slash set in a 3D environment. The game is intended to give the players a feeling of being swarmed by demons and constricted by a time limit as they must defeat the quickly multiplying enemies that have inhabited this game world.
2008-2009 Games.customhtml:
To create the game, programmers use a game engine, a pre-made toolset for game devlopment. Gunther is the first game done by the Game Developers Club to use a student-made game engine. Gunther uses the engine, Mercury, a multi-platform multi-threaded game engine written in C++. The engine has been developed over the past four years by members of the club and is an Open Source engine available for download and use.

For the art assets, artists created 3D models in programs like Maya and 3D Studio Max. They construct characters and objects using primitive polygons, like spheres and cubes. Once modeled, objects are UV mapped, a process that converts the 3D faces of a model to a 2D plane. Using this map, artists can paint over it and map it back on to the model, completing a process known as texturing. Finally, for characters, models are given bones and joints known as a rig so that an animator may give the character life.

2005-2006 Projects.name: Project Tetra Code Design
2005-2006 Projects.description: Project Tetra uses a multi-layered design. Each layer of code is designed to provide the above layer with an interface for using its functionality. This means that no one layer of code has to concern itself with the full complexity of the game code.
2005-2006 Projects.customhtml:
C# Script System
Script Interface
Code
Gamebryo - Game Engine
DirectX - Toolset

The bottom layer is a toolset known as DirectX. DirectX provides the application with an interface to the graphics hardware (Direct3D) as well as interfaces to input devices (Direct Input). DirectX is provided by Microsoft for free and is the most commonly used toolset for graphics in Windows.

The next layer is Gamebryo which is a Game Engine. Gamebryo provides an interface for creating basic game objects. It hides the DirectX layer and therefore simplifies the above layers of code. Gamebryo is not specific to Project Tetra but rather generalized game code written by a company known as Emergent.

On top of Gamebryo sits the game layer. This layer consists of code specific to the game. It is written in C++ and is compiled into the application. It manages the core game play functionality that is not likely to change during the development process.

Next there is the script interface layer. This layer consists of managed C++ that can be used by the script system. This layer acts as a middle man between the core game code and the script system.

The top layer is our C# script system. The script system is used to easily modify the game. Scripts define things such as character classes and character skills. They are also used to make basic decisions such as what music to play or when to open a door.

2005-2006 Projects.name: Mercury
2005-2006 Projects.description: Mercury is a C++, Open Source, Multi-platform, Multi-threaded Game Engine that runs fully featured on Linux and Windows®. It is worked on by a few GDC members. Mercury compiles in GCC3.2 - 4.1 in Linux, and many different compilers in Windows®.
2005-2006 Projects.customhtml:
Mercury isn't just a graphics library, but a full programming environment. In general, code designed to be run in Mercury needs not to make calls to the system or any functions that would be platform dependent. Despite this, Mercury should remain small and applications that utilize it should not have to suffer exaggerated load times for features they do not use. Mercury's registration system allows different features to be compiled in without modification of other code. For example, if there is no need for physics in your project, the ODE library and code (what we use for physics) can simply not be linked and ODE will not be used.

Mercury is designed around open source fundamentals. Most of what you will see supported in Mercury and used with Mercury is Open. We feel that you should be able to develop a great game without having to purchase proprietary tools and systems.

Mercury's primary goal is speed. Mercury sacrifices some of the benefits that are gained by clean coding when a noticeable performance increase can be found for the end user. Assembly code for common math functions being compiled in Windows for extra performance is an example of the paramount of speed in Mercury. We've re-written some of the STL data types for added functionality as well as improved performance.
